FacilityName: Occidental Chemical Corp., Muscle Shoals Facility

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The OxyChem facility at Muscle Shoals, Alabama is a producer of industrial chemicals.  OxyChem is a wholly owned subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (? 68.155(a))

OxyChem has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the Muscle Shoals facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the Muscle Shoals facility.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (? 68.155(b))

The OxyChem Muscle Shoals facility consists of two chemical producing plants that are either wholly owned by OxyChem, or exist as joint ventures with other companies.  OxyChem operates all plants at the site.  The facility handles one substance that is regulated by the RMP rule.  The substance is as follows:

Chlorine

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (? 68.155(d))

The Muscle Shoals facility?s prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures
Training, Mechanical Integrity, Management of Change
Pre-Startup Review, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigation
Employee Participation, Key Procedures, Contractors

Each of the items listed above are documented and mai

ntained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident History (? 68.155(e))

There were no RMP accidents at this facility in the past 5 years.

Emergency Response Program (? 68.155(f))

The Muscle Shoals facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (?ERT?) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response time of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plant's Emergency Command Center (?ECC?).  In addition, the Muscle Shoals facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (?SSP?) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporate Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility is a member of the Colbert County Local Emergency Planning Committee (?LEPC?), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (? 68.155(g))

The Muscle Shoals facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.

Certification Statement

To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
